name: Baga Beach
blurb: Lively beach known for water sports and nightlife.
description: Baga Beach is one of Goa's most popular beaches...

name: Fort Aguada
description: A massive and well-preserved Portuguese fort overseeing the Arabian Sea. The lighthouse and ramparts make it a photogenic spot.

name: Basilica of Bom Jesus
blurb: UNESCO site housing St. Francis Xavier’s relics.
description: A UNESCO World Heritage baroque church famous for its architecture and the mortal remains of St. Francis Xavier.

name: Chapora Fort
blurb: Iconic sunset point overlooking Vagator beach.
description: Popularized by films, Chapora offers panoramic views of the coastline and is a favorite for sunsets and photography.

name: Anjuna Beach
blurb: Bohemian vibe with flea market & cafés.
description: Known for its Wednesday flea market, relaxed cafés and a backpacker vibe. Pleasant for long walks and sunsets.

name: Dudhsagar Falls
description: One of India’s tallest waterfalls. Requires a short trek/jeep safari. Monsoon and post‑monsoon are especially dramatic.

name: Miramar Beach
blurb: City beach by the Mandovi estuary.
description: A calm urban beach popular with locals. Great for evening strolls, near Dona Paula and Panaji city attractions.

name: Dona Paula Viewpoint
blurb: Scenic viewpoint where rivers meet the sea.
description: Offers sweeping views of the Arabian Sea. Nearby jetty and promenade make it a photogenic stop.

name: Our Lady of the Immaculate Conception Church
blurb: Landmark white church with grand stairways.
description: A Panaji icon known for its white façade and zig-zag steps. Illuminated beautifully in the evenings.

name: Anjuna Flea Market
description: Seasonal Wednesday flea market with indie fashion, jewelry and souvenirs. Great for browsing and bites.
